Proverbs__07.1: My son, keep my words, and lay up my precepts with thee. Son,
Proverbs__07.2: Keep my commandments, and thou shalt live: and my law as the apple of thy eye:
Proverbs__07.3: Bind it upon thy fingers, write it upon the tables of thy heart.
Proverbs__07.4: Say to wisdom: Thou art my sister: and call prudence thy friend,
Proverbs__07.5: That she may keep thee from the woman that is not thine, and from the stranger who sweeteneth her words.
Proverbs__07.6: For I look out of the window of my house through the lattice,
Proverbs__07.7: And I see little ones, I behold a foolish young man,
Proverbs__07.8: Who passeth through the street by the corner, and goeth nigh the way of her house.
Proverbs__07.9: In the dark, when it grows late, in the darkness and obscurity of the night,
Proverbs__07.10: And behold a woman meeteth him in harlot's attire prepared to deceive souls; talkative and wandering,
Proverbs__07.11: Not bearing to be quiet, not able to abide still at home,
Proverbs__07.12: Now abroad, now in the streets, now lying in wait near the corners.
Proverbs__07.13: And catching the young man, she kisseth him, and with an impudent face, flattereth, saying:
Proverbs__07.14: I vowed victims for prosperity, this day I have paid my vows.
Proverbs__07.15: Therefore I am come out to meet thee, desirous to see thee, and I have found thee.
Proverbs__07.16: I have woven my bed with cords, I have covered it with painted tapestry, brought from Egypt.
Proverbs__07.17: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Proverbs__07.18: Come, let us be inebriated with the breasts, and let us enjoy the desired embraces, till the day appear.
Proverbs__07.19: For my husband is not at home, he is gone a very long journey.
Proverbs__07.20: He took with him a bag of money: he will return home the day of the full moon.
Proverbs__07.21: She entangled him with many words, and drew him away with the flattery of her lips.
Proverbs__07.22: Immediately he followeth her as an ox led to be a victim, and as a lamb playing the wanton, and not knowing that he is drawn like a fool to bonds,
Proverbs__07.23: Till the arrow pierce his liver: as if a bird should make haste to the snare, and knoweth not that his life is in danger.
Proverbs__07.24: Now therefore, my son, hear me, and attend to the words of my mouth.
Proverbs__07.25: Let not thy mind be drawn away in her ways: neither be thou deceived with her paths.
Proverbs__07.26: For she hath cast down many wounded, and the strongest have been slain by her.
Proverbs__07.27: Her house is the way to hell, reaching even to the inner chambers of death.
